definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to perform the ritual bows/to follow the customary ceremonies

sentences.english: Raise the national flag. Play the national anthem. Salute!
sentences.chinese: 升國旗，奏國歌，全體行禮。

sentences.english: The guard saluted the general smartly.
sentences.chinese: 衛兵非常精神地向將軍行禮。

sentences.english: He bowed down to the Queen.
In bows and curtsies, it's the lower-status person who indicates that they're going to make a reverence first.
sentences.chinese: 行禮致意時，總由身份低的人，先行一步，表示敬意。

sentences.english: Poulengey salutes, and stands at the door awaiting orders.
sentences.chinese: 波侖日行禮，站在門口聽侯命令。

sentences.english: We salute the flag every Monday at school.
sentences.chinese: 我們在學校每週一向國旗行禮。

sentences.english: All the men in the court bowed before the king as he entered.
sentences.chinese: 國王進來時，宮廷裏所有人都向他躬身行禮。

sentences.english: Now you bow and I curtsy.
Head suddenly come to a man robbed Amys salute box.
sentences.chinese: 迎面忽然過來一中年男子搶走了艾米的行禮箱。
安塔芮絲人衛兵向他鞠躬行禮。

sentences.english: We salute the flag everyday at school.
sentences.chinese: 我們在學校每天向國旗行禮。

sentences.english: These days, we realize that the salute itself is the motions and the words.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們明白，行禮是動作加言詞。

sentences.english: Recognizing the Regent's chief scientist, they immediately genuflected and offered their salute.
sentences.chinese: 他們認出了瑞金特的首席科學家，立刻跪地行禮致敬。

sentences.english: And all your sheaves came around it and bowed down to my sheaf.
sentences.chinese: 而你們的幾捆則過來站在它周圍對它鞠躬行禮。

sentences.english: Former Swiss Guards salute in the Castelgrande in Bellinzona, southern Switzerland, April 6, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 前任瑞士衛隊在南瑞士貝林索納的大城堡行禮。

definition: to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
